website_summaries.verdict: This reliable unit boasts the largest bandwidth of any D-Link modem we considered, and includes a set of helpful features that makes setup and connecting easy.
pros: 2600 Mbps is enough to match the bandwidth of all but the highest tier routers
The unit holds its connection to the router reliably
Includes Smartbeam technology to focus on currently connected devices without wasting bandwidth
Smart Signal indicator locates the best spot in the home for maximum range
This unit can cover most areas of even larger-than-average homes
cons: Some users report that the connection between router and extender must be re-established if the modem reboots

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. Don't buy this brand
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this, I got it because it was affordable compared to what's out there & I highly regret it. Watch a video on how long it takes to set up & it never works with the app till you reset it. Then expect it to stop working sometimes 3 times a month & then it needs to be programmed again & again. I have a top of the line router so I know it's not that. If you buy this after what I've told you, you will be doomed to be retarded without a WiFi signal the end.
customer_reviews.author: The dude

customer_reviews.title: A lot of time with D-Link Support - AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this WiFi extender as an open box. It was out of warranty but D-Link Support waved the fees in order to get me up and running so I could connect to my camera. The issues with connecting with my Altop Camera is NOT with the Extender or Router. The problem is with the Altop camera and their tech support has given up. So the extender doesn't connect the camera to my desktop software provided by the camera manufacturer. D-Link on the other hand has the best - most patient tech support staff I've ever had the privilege to communicate with ever! They are more than AWESOME! Altop Cameras on the other hand ... consider other manufactures.
customer_reviews.author: Toda

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have a D-Link AC3200 and it has been wonderful. I added the AC2600 Plug In Wall Signal Booster and I have been very happy with the ease and reliability of the unit. Setup was so simple! Simply plug it in and connect via the WPS method. It popped right up in my network and you can log in and play with settings just as you would on a D-Link router. Signal strength has been great, and I love that I can plug in another device via the gigabit port such as a NAS or desktop. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Casey S

customer_reviews.title: Easiest setup ever
customer_reviews.text: Our challenge was a 3000 Sq. Ft. old brick house with plaster walls. We have 1 gig fiber that even with a very high quality router, couldn’t make it upstairs. I’ve tried 4 other extenders to no avail. Was almost ready to get a mesh system and then I read a review about this baby. This one did the trick. I’m reasonably tech savvy and comfortable researching solutions, but needed none of that for this setup. It was installed, running, and customized in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: D-Link AC2600 Wi-Fi Range Extender isn't a Wireless Bridge
customer_reviews.text: This seems like it would work great, but it's absolutely *not* a "wireless bridge". It has all of the pieces, but the software doesn't offer that as an option. It is just a wifi range extender that can either take a wifi signal aand essentially rebroadcast it, or it can take a wired (incoming) connection and rebroadcast that, like a normal basic access point would. It does not act as a wireless bridge, which should connect to an aaccesspoint and retransmit that signal over its wired connection (incoming and outgoing), allowing remote wired computers to leverage the wireless connection from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Brak

customer_reviews.title: Weak Wi-Fi but excellent Ethernet port
customer_reviews.text: I have given a poor review before (1-star), because I was getting a 90 Mbps download & 400 Mbps upload on a 1Gig Fiber (up & down) (basement to main floor). But after comparing to TP-Link, Tenda, and Netgear, this D-Link gave the BEST result of all of them (twice Wi-Fi speed of them all). Reliability is great so far after 3 months. It is aldo also very easy to set up. Technology apparently can not duplicate a Wi-Fi extender without big Wi-Fi speed drop.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia T.

customer_reviews.title: Best Repeater Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Seriously, wow! This thing rocks!!!! I had problems setting it up, called tech service, waited less than 5 minutes and the guy was so patient with this non-nerd. Even though it was only showing one bar of signal strength, it is giving me a FULL signal in my bedroom, which has NEVER, EVER had reliable internet, and I see that it is now showing two bars (out of three) of strength. This slick thing is worth every penny!!!! We have multiple computers, tablets and three Fire TV sticks, get our television over the internet, but since I plugged this into the system, there is very little lag, even when 4 or 5 different electronics are sucking up internet.
customer_reviews.author: TamScamp

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to extend the signal from my DLink 890DL router. It works perfectly. Just push the WPS button on both devices, and it's up and running. Signal is strong, and speed is good. It plugs directly into the bottom plug of a wall outlet, while leaving the top plug open. Has very easy to understand status indicator lights on the front. You can simply walk by and see the status of your device and the signal. It will create a second network SSID name, ie. "Network Name-EXT", but my devices switch between the networks seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT !
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. I had a Asus repeater (I have a Asus router so I thought they would play well together) that was really fussy and smoked in less than a year. Bought this unit, and set it up in < 15 minutes. My router is in my basement and I was having trouble getting a good constant Wi-Fi signal on my porch. This unit completely solved the problem. As some have mentioned, it is rather large (about the size of a blackboard eraser) but it looks kinda geeky so that was not a problem for me. 100 % satisfied !
customer_reviews.author: William G. Rushworth

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Originally had the DAP 1320 on the upstairs outlet for an extender. This unit is 100% better. Before I had 2 bars on my iphone and ipad. Now I have a full 5 bars for wifi access. The main router is the Dlink DIR 868 L which is good by itself. I probably should upgrade the main unit soon but as far as I know its still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: GNiec

customer_reviews.title: Dead after Firmware update
customer_reviews.text: The DAP 1860 extender disconnected frequently from a Dlink DIR 882. Installed FW 104 the had nothing but problems. Device would not factory reset, device take 5 minutes to boot. Wireless extender function timed our every attempt (allowed for minutes before timeout) Factory reset failed and password did not match my set password or the factory password. I will by netgear instead.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Love this extender!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Works flawlessly and extends the coverage in my home very well! I had a D-Link Wireless Range Extender (DAP-1330) and it just wasn't cutting it (frequently needed to be rebooted and the signal wasn't that strong after being repeated - Hulu would buffer like crazy and my house isn't that big). Now, I don't need to reboot and Hulu streams flawlessly. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey in Paradise

customer_reviews.text: Mine was working great for months. Now suddenly it has the same problem you have but worse. It still transmits the SSID but the internet is Not available. If I turn it off and back on or un plug it for 60 seconds and plug it back in it starts working again but only for about 1 hour and then its down again. WHAT GIVES.... ???

product_meta.title: D-Link WiFi Range Extender, AC2600 Plug In Wall Signal Booster, Wireless Repeater Internet Smart MU-MIMO (DAP-1860)
product_meta.description:
Model:AC2600 MU-MIMO w/ Gigabit Port

The D-Link DAP-1860 AC2600 Wi-Fi Range Extender delivers the ultimate performance for the most demanding tasks, like 4K video streaming, gaming, and multiple device usage. With a sleek design and wireless speeds of up to 2,532 Mbps, the DAP-1860 will let you enjoy a fast wireless connection. Featuring a 4 x 4 antenna configuration as well as Smart Connect and Smart Beam technology, the DAP-1860 offers better data rates, fewer dead spots, more coverage, and increased reliability. It also includes an Access Point mode that is ideal for homes that are pre-wired for Ethernet or for extended coverage. You'll extend Wi-Fi coverage throughout your home and even into your backyard, creating a stronger signal in all of those hard-to-reach areas.

The DAP-1860 also utilizes MU-MIMO technology, which allows multiple devices to get high-bandwidth Wi-Fi signals at the same time. This distributes data more efficiently, giving you the fastest Wi-Fi speeds and allowing you to stream 4K and HD media faster, transfer large files quickly, and play lag-free gaming.

Furthermore, this Wi-Fi range extender’s dual-band technology helps reduce the interference from nearby wireless transmitters in the home and also provides backward compatibility with older wireless devices in your network. For optimal performance and to take full advantage of the latest AC technology, pair the DAP-1860 with the D-Link Ultra Series routers or the AC1900 Wi-Fi USB adapter (DWA-192).

The DAP-1860 is easy to install. The one-piece wall plug design is compact, portable, and does not require additional power cables. The Smart Signal Indicator will help you find the best location for placing the DAP-1860 to provide optimal Wi-Fi coverage throughout your home. Use the QRS Mobile app or the built-in setup wizard for simple setup and configuration.
feature_bullets: Simultaneous dual band Wi-Fi: Extend both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Wi-Fi at the same time for a more reliable Wi-Fi network
Connect multiple devices: MU MIMO technology handles high bandwidth network traffic on multiple devices at the same time
AC Smart Beam: Tracks your connected devices for enhanced Wi-Fi speed and range. SDRAM:128 MB
Smart connect: Allocates the best possible band for optimal Wi-Fi performance
Smart signal indicator: Indicator will help you find the best location to place the DAP 1860 for optimal Wi-Fi coverage throughout your home
One push setup: Easily sync up with your router by clicking on Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) button
Intuitive user interface: Use the built in setup wizard and QRS Mobile app for simple setup and configuration

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars130 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
